title: `forge create` and `forge verify-contract` not verifying contracts correctly
body:
### Component

Forge

### Have you ensured that all of these are up to date?

- [X] Foundry
- [ ] Foundryup

### What version of Foundry are you on?

forge 0.2.0 (ec3f9bd 2023-09-19T13:46:42.143604000Z)

### What command(s) is the bug in?

forge create; forge verify-contract

### Operating System

macOS (Apple Silicon)

### Describe the bug

**TL;DRL: `forge create` is not verifying contracts on Etherscan (Ethereum Mainnet) and `forge verify-contract` is not verifying contracts on Etherscan (Ethereum Mainnet) without explicit `--compiler-version` setting.**

`forge create` with `--verify` flag always fails on Etherscan (Ethereum Mainnet) despite passing all necessary params. I can't get this to work under any configuration.

`forge verify-contract` falsely reports successful verification, while the verified code would not appear on etherscan. Only explicitly passed `--compiler-version` param specifying the compiler version makes the command actually verify contract.

**All of the details, exact steps and exact configuration can be found in the PoC repo linked below
https://github.com/barrutko/verification-issue-poc**
